props.title:
High-Performance
Web Dev with deco.cx
props.subtitle: From Beginner to Expert: Master deco.cx for Elite Web and Storefront Development

props.title: Leading brands demand websites and digital storefronts that capture attention in milliseconds: fast and personalized experiences.
props.subtitle: ...Yet, the supply of developers equipped to deliver these needs lags far behind.

cardProblem.title: Slow Performance
cardProblem.content: Achieving near-instantaneous load times remains a demanding challenge, critical for user retention.

cardProblem.title: Hard to Personalize
cardProblem.content: Tailoring content to resonate with each visitor's unique preferences is a nuanced art few have mastered.

cardProblem.title: Poor Collaboration
cardProblem.content: Developers rarely build websites that enable marketing teams and other stakeholders to manage and update with ease.

cardProblem.title: Overwhelming Choices
cardProblem.content: Selecting the right stack from an ever-expanding arsenal is daunting yet essential for high-performance outcomes.

cardProblem.title: Skill Upgradation
cardProblem.content: Staying current with the evolving web development landscape is hard without a clear direction or mentorship.

cardProblem.title: Integration Overload
cardProblem.content: Merging various platforms and tools into a cohesive system is complex, often hindering developer productivity.

props.title: This masterclass is meticulously designed to bridge this gap.

topics.text: You'll launch top-tier websites and headless storefronts with unmatched speed.
You'll create scalable, highly personalized digital experiences.
You'll enhance team collaboration, simplifying site updates for non-dev roles.
You'll confidently manage live sites with deco.cx's robust monitoring suite.
You'll emerge as a forward-thinking developer, equipped for the web's evolution.
You'll expertly tackle and debug real-world project challenges.

props.subTitle: By the end of the course...

value.title:
Learn about the latest trends in

web development

cardWorks.title: Watch Pre-Recorded Video Classes
cardWorks.content: Every week day we will launch a new video (60 min long), you can watch by yourself or join our watch party at 6pm.

cardWorks.title: Do your Homework Exercises
cardWorks.content: Learn by doing. By the end of every video you will also get a suggestion of an exercise to help you consolidate your learnings.

cardWorks.title: Join Live Coding Sessions With Mentors
cardWorks.content: Right after the watch party, the respective mentor will host a live coding session that showcases the next proposed exercise.

cardWorks.title: Submit your Work and Become a Certified Partner
cardWorks.content: At the end of decoCamp, you can choose to submit the work done and get certified.

mentors.content: As the founding software engineer at deco.cx, Gaudencio has spearheaded educational initiatives and provided crucial support. Prior to this role, he served as a licensed computer science teacher at UFCG, where he took on responsibilities for chairs in web development and infrastructure. Additionally, Gaudencio led Public-Private Partnership (PPP) projects with industry giants like Lenovo and VTEX. With a decade-long tenure at UFCG, Matheus impacted the lives of over 1000 students.

Tiago is a software developer with a solid academic background, having graduated from Ecole Polytechnique in Paris and obtained a master's degree in Artificial Intelligence from HKUST. Over the past six years, he has dedicated his expertise to web development and optimizing frontend performance at leading ecommerce solutions. His journey reflects a commitment to staying updated with technological advances, enabling him to navigate the dynamic field of software development.

Luciano JÃºnior, a.k.a Lucis, has been coding since he was 7 and is passionate about creating simple solutions of make people's lives better. He is an advocate of the Web and has experience in building multi-tenant scalable applications, especially with his favorite language: Typescript. Lucis is also passionate about education, having mentored and lectured in his area since his college degree in Computer Science at UFCG. He follows the mantra "Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication".

HÃ©ricles is a software engineer dedicated to enhancing user experiences through UI/UX development, styling, and web animations. Grounded in a solid foundation from UFCG, he infuses his work with a blend of technical expertise and creative innovation. Over the past few years, he has also been actively involved in contributing to and maintaining open-source projects across various computer science fields while remaining committed to crafting visually captivating designs that not only meet functional needs but also inspire and delight users.

Guilherme Rodrigues, co-founder and CEO of Deco.cx, is a distinguished software engineer with a robust background in computer science from PUC-Rio. His innovative work includes pioneering one of Brazil's first taxi apps and making significant contributions to the growth of VTEX, enhancing e-commerce across Latin America. Guilherme is dedicated to nurturing the next wave of tech talent, using his extensive experience to foster innovation and drive excellence in web development.

Viktor is a software developer with a passion for crafting innovative solutions to complex problems. Commited to continuous learning and improvement, he is dedicated to staying abreast of the latest technologies and industry trends, always seeking opportunities to apply those cutting-edge tools to real-world problems.

items.answer: deco.cx is the web builder for the Post-AI era. It is a modern alternative to WordPress built with TypeScript, React and Tailwind
items.question: What's deco.cx?

items.answer: Absolutely, if you intent to enroll more than 5 students from the same company, please reach out.

items.answer: Sure thing! You can choose between a regular student and get access only to the content or becoming an Official Certified Partner.

questions.answer: Deco.cx is the frontend platform that bridges the gap between basic no-code site builders and complex full-code setups, allowing businesses of all sizes to create high-performance, fully personalized and AI-native web experiences. Our open-source platform bundles the best-in-class of framework, hosting, CMS, visual editor and code editor.
questions.question: What is deco.cx?

questions.answer: No, deco.cx acts as a complementary headless frontend layer for your existing commerce platform. It integrates seamlessly with any commerce platform that has open APIs, enhancing your store's development, performance and experience, without replacing your current system.
questions.question: Does deco.cx replace my current commerce platform?

questions.answer: Deco.cx uses Deno, Preact, Tailwind, and Fresh. Deno offers a secure runtime for JavaScript and TypeScript, while Preact is a lightweight, React-compatible framework. Tailwind facilitates optimized web styling, and Fresh is a modern server-side web framework designed for Deno.
questions.question: What tech stack does deco.cx use?

questions.answer: Deco.cx employs state-of-the-art techniques to deliver the smallest payloads with minimal latency. These techniques encompass server-side rendering, dynamic image resizing and encoding, server actions, an islands architecture, just-in-time CSS generation, and edge infrastructure spread across 35 regions, among many others.
questions.question: How does deco.cx ensure fast websites?

questions.answer: Yes, deco.cx can seamlessly integrate with a wide range of marketing tools and platforms, enabling you to streamline your marketing efforts and enhance customer engagement.
questions.question: Can deco.cx integrate with existing marketing tools?

questions.answer: Yes, deco.cx is built to support multi-language and multi-regional functionalities, making it an ideal solution for global ecommerce platforms seeking to provide localized experiences.
questions.question: Does deco.cx support multi-language and multi-region ecommerce sites?

questions.answer: deco.cx provides extensive developer support including: detailed documentation, a responsive community on Discord, and direct access to our technical team for guidance and troubleshooting.
questions.question: What kind of support does deco.cx offer for developers?

questions.answer: Absolutely! deco.cx is designed to scale with your business, whether you are a startup or a large enterprise.
questions.question: Is deco.cx suitable for businesses of all sizes?

questions.answer: For an in-depth understanding of deco.cx, join our community on Discord, read our documentation, or connect with our sales team.
questions.question: How can I learn more about deco.cx?

questions.answer: Implementing deco.cx involves migrating your ecommerce store's frontend to our tech stack. This can be efficiently executed by one of deco.cx's system integration partner agencies (SIs), an independent tech expert, or your in-house development team. The time frame varies from 2 weeks to 3 months, depending on your store's complexity. Access our deco Hub for a list of certified SI partners.
questions.question: What does the implementation process with deco.cx look like?

questions.answer: About 80% is already open source at deco-cx/deco (our engine) and deco-cx/apps (our integrations). We are working hard to provide a fully self-hosted and open source version in Q1 2024. Bear with us as we nail the final details that will allow for long term extensibility.
questions.question: Is deco.cx open-source?

questions.answer: Yes! Starting from 9 USD / mo you can add custom domains for unlimited sites (according to our free usage policy limits) and even invite collaborators to edit content.
questions.question: As a developer, can I host multiple customer projects in my personal team?
